title: Openblas 0.2.20 and lower won't build in Spack-0.14.0
body:
I am trying to build openblas 0.2.20 with Spack 0.14 and it is failing with the following error (any gcc/intel compiler, Intel haswell/skylake, CentOS7):
```
8245    x86_64: invalid option -- 'r'
     8246    x86_64: Try `x86_64 --help' for more information.
  >> 8247    make[2]: *** [../../libopenblas_haswellp-r0.2.20.a] Error 1
     8248    make[2]: Leaving directory `/tmp/amaji/spack-stage-openblas-0.2.20-jlc5tqmg57npedtcykkilsizxroxa55f/spack-src/la
             pack-netlib/SRC'
  >> 8249    make[1]: *** [lapacklib] Error 2
     8250    make[1]: Leaving directory `/tmp/amaji/spack-stage-openblas-0.2.20-jlc5tqmg57npedtcykkilsizxroxa55f/spack-src/la
             pack-netlib'
  >> 8251    make: *** [netlib] Error 2
```
The Make arguments passed by Spack are:
```
==> [2020-03-04-15:13:34.969668, 34009] 'make' 'CC=/scratch/rice/a/amaji/spack-test-20200303/framework/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc' 'FC=/scratch/rice/a/amaji/spack-test-20200303/framework/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gfortran' 'MAKE_NO_J=1' 'ARCH=x86_64' 'TARGET=HASWELL' 'USE_OPENMP=1' 'USE_THREAD=1' 'libs' 'netlib' 'shared'
```
I suspect, in older Openblas there is no `ARCH=x86_64` argument. This is forcing use of `x86_64 -ru` instead of `ar -ru` like this:
```
x86_64 -ru ../../libopenblas_haswellp-r0.2.20.a sbdsvdx.o spotrf2.o sgetrf2.o sgbbrd.o sgbcon.o sgbequ.o sgbrfs.o sgbsv.o sgbsvx.o sgbtf2.o sgbtrf.o sgbtrs.o sgebak.o sgebal.o sgebd2.o sgebrd.o sgecon.o sgeequ.o sgees.o sgeesx.o sgeev.o sgeevx.o sgehd2.o sgehrd.o sgelq2.o sgelqf.o sgels.o sgelsd.o sgelss.o sgelsy.o sgeql2.o sgeqlf.o sgeqp3.o sgeqr2.o sgeqr2p.o sgeqrf.o sgeqrfp.o sgerfs.o sgerq2.o sgerqf.o sgesc2.o .........
```
If I remove `ARCH=x86_64` from the make arguments, things build fine. I suspect the following commit introduced this behavior.
https://github.com/spack/spack/commit/ca6e75c9f678ecf603354531cfec68ab4a121def

Can you please take a look and fix this? Openblas 0.2.20 was building fine in Spack 0.13.x. 

On an unrelated issue, 
I patched the Openblas package in my custom_packages directory and installed it with spack. 
```
$ spack find -lp openblas@0.2.20 %gcc@4.8.5
==> 1 installed package
-- linux-centos7-haswell / gcc@4.8.5 ----------------------------
ouzv3uh openblas@0.2.20  /scratch/rice/a/amaji/spack-test-20200303/apps/openblas/0.2.20-gcc-4.8.5-ouzv3uh
```
If I try to install openblas again spack detects the previous install.
```
$ spack install openblas@0.2.20 %gcc@4.8.5
[+] /scratch/rice/a/amaji/spack-test-20200303/apps/openblas/0.2.20-gcc-4.8.5-ouzv3uh
```
But if Spack is trying to install a package that depends on `openblas@0.2.20` such as `r` (same variant and everything) it tries to reinstall openblas. Even weirder thing is that it is ignoring my `custom_packages` definition of openblas package and trying to use the openblas from `var/spack/repos/builtin` and fails again! This may be somewhat related to the concretization bug https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/15384

Am I missing something? Why does Spack use different openblas package definitions (custom_packages vs. builtin) for explicit install vs. implicit install?
